--- title: "tidyverse 2.0.0" date: 2023-03-08 image: "tidyverse-2-0-0.png" image-alt: "tidyverse 2.0.0. Images of various hex stickers from packages in the tidyverse." categories: - "tidyverse" description: tidyverse 2.0.0 has been released! engine: knitr format: html: toc: true editor: source --- Install the latest version of the tidyverse with: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages("tidyverse") ``` ::: Load the tidyverse with: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library("tidyverse") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ─────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0.9000 ── ✔ dplyr 1.1.0 ✔ readr 2.1.4 ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.0.9000 ✔ ggplot2 3.4.1.9000 ✔ tibble 3.2.0 ✔ lubridate 1.9.2 ✔ tidyr 1.3.0.9000 ✔ purrr 1.0.1.9000 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ℹ Use the ]8;;http://conflicted.r-lib.org/conflicted package]8;; to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ::: Did you notice?
Click to reveal! ## Welcome to the core tidyverse
[lubridate](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/)!


lubridate is now part of the core tidyverse! Loading the tidyverse automatically attaches lubridate, meaning that you do not have load it separately.
## conflicted package You may have noticed this message: ```bash ℹ Use the conflicted package to force all conflicts to become errors ``` tidyverse 2.0.0 now advertises the [conflicted package](https://conflicted.r-lib.org/). Packages can have conflicts (i.e., contain functions of the same name). Normally, the package loaded last "wins" and masks (overrides) the other function, resulting in confusing errors. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(dplyr) library(MASS) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'MASS' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr': select ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} select ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` function (obj) UseMethod("select") ``` ::: ::: With conflicted, you get an explicit error: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(conflicted) library(dplyr) library(MASS) select ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ``` Error: ! [conflicted] select found in 2 packages. Either pick the one you want with `::`: • MASS::select • dplyr::select Or declare a preference with `conflicts_prefer()`: • `conflicts_prefer(MASS::select)` • `conflicts_prefer(dplyr::select)` ``` ::: ::: It asks you to either identify the namespace for each call: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dplyr::select ``` ::: Or, declare a preference with `conflicts_prefer()`: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} conflicts_prefer(dplyr::filter) ``` ::: That way you know there's a problem and how to resolve it. ## Learn more * [tidyverse blog: tidyverse 2.0.0](https://www.tidyverse.org/blog/2023/03/tidyverse-2-0-0/) * [tidyverse release notes](https://tidyverse.tidyverse.org/news/index.html)
